column2: GA DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Georgia
column6: GA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column6: U-turns are not allowed.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 2. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: green and white.
column6: black and orange.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column6: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column8: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.

column2: 4. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic signal ahead
column6: Yield the right-of-way

column2: 6. Warning signs normally are:
column4: rectangles.
column6: diamond-shaped.

column2: 7. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: the law.
column6: what is not allowed.

column2: 8. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column8: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 9. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: of two-way traffic
column6: of a reduction of lanes

column2: 10. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Pentagon
column6: Round

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for trucks entering from the side
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 12. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column4: no left turn
column6: no U-turn

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: No U-Turn
column6: Crossroads ahead

column2: 14. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Road curves ahead
column6: Slippery when wet

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Two-way Traffic
column6: Keep right

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: lane ends, merge left.
column6: road construction.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian Crossing
column6: Multiple Turns

column2: 19. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column6: Construction warning.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway begins
column6: Keep left

column2: 21. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 22. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: accelerate much faster
column6: stop much more quickly

column2: 23. Alcohol:
column4: increases reaction time.
column6: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 24. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.

column2: 25. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column6: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.

column2: 26. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 27. You may pass on the right of another vehicle:
column4: when traveling on a multi-lane highway with two or more lanes of traffic in the same direction.
column6: when the other vehicle is waiting to turn left, when a lane is provided to pass on the right.

column2: 28. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

column2: 29. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.

column2: 30. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.

column2: 31. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column6: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 32. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 33. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.
column6: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.
column8: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.

column2: 34. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 35. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.
column6: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column8: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.

column2: 36. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 37. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column8: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

column2: 38. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: The other answers are both correct.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.

column2: 39. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Young people.
column6: Drivers who are driving alone.

column2: 40. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column4: on the front.
column6: on the right.
